org.kepler.gui

Class TabbedDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • org.kepler.gui.TabbedDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActorDialog

    public abstract class TabbedDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    Base class for Actor, Director and Workflow dialogs, containing a JTabbedPane to which any number of tabs may be added at runtime. Also has OK, Apply, Cancel and Help buttons at the bottom of the dialog
    Since:
    27 February 2006
    Author:
    Matthew Brooke
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • _addTab

        protected void _addTab(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                       java.lang.String tabText)
        Add a new tab to the TabbedDialog, which will act as a container for the passed JPanel, and which will have the title text specified in tabText. Tab will be added at the next available position
        Parameters:
        panel - JPanel
        tabText - String

      • _selectTab

        protected void _selectTab(AbstractDialogTab dialogTab)
        bring the requested tab to the front in the TabbedDialog.
        Parameters:
        dialogTab - AbstractDialogTab

      • _okAction

        protected void _okAction()
        method that is called when user clicks the "OK" button. May be overridden by derived classes

      • _applyAction

        protected boolean _applyAction()
        method that is called when user clicks the "Apply" button. May be overridden by derived classes. this method contains a call to _validateInput() on ach of the contained AbstractDialogTabs; if _validateInput() returns false for any of these tab-panels, then this method, in turn, will return false
        Returns:
        boolean true if apply worked, false if not (eg if there were validation errors etc.)

      • _cancelAction

        protected void _cancelAction()
        method that is called when user clicks the "Cancel" button. May be overridden by derived classes

      • _helpAction

        protected void _helpAction()
        method that is called when user clicks the "Help" button. Shows top-level help pages, but may be overridden by derived classes to provide context-sensitive help

      • getConfiguration

        protected static Configuration getConfiguration()
